```
➜  grpc git:(master) ✗ ls /usr/local/include/grpc
byte_buffer.h        census.h             grpc.h               grpc_zookeeper.h     support
byte_buffer_reader.h compression.h        grpc_security.h      status.h
```

it only can't install with npm,maybe 

```
CXXFLAGS=-I<custom location>/include LDFLAGS=-L<custom location>/lib npm install [grpc]
```

but, it can't be sucesss

CXXFLAGS=-I/usr/local/include LDFLAGS=-L/usr/local/lib npm install grpc

➜  node git:(master) ✗ node-gyp rebuild
gyp info it worked if it ends with ok
gyp info using node-gyp@3.0.1
gyp info using node@0.10.38 | darwin | x64

➜  node git:(master) ✗

The problem here is that you are installing version 0.10.1 of the Node library and you are installing the C core library from master. Those are incompatible. I would suggest installing the C core using homebrew, or from the branch release_0.10 in the git repository, or from the source dump in the [0.10.2 release](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/releases/tag/release-0_10_2) on GitHub. Alternatively, you can install the Node library directly from the git repository you currently have.
The cause of this problem is pretty clear. Without more information from the reporter, there is nothing to fix.
